infoSections.text: C++ is essential in neurotechnology for its high performance, efficiency, and ability to process complex neural computations in BCIs and neuroimaging. It enables real-time signal processing, machine learning, and hardware optimization, making it crucial for tasks like feature extraction and brain-computer communication. Many neuroscience tools, such as OpenBCI, ITK, and VTK, rely on C++ for their core functions. Learning C++ provides a strong foundation for developing high-performance applications and working with embedded systems in neurotech.

tasks.taskDescription:
Complete either of the following programs. Send a screenshot of your completion screen upon finishing the course. If you are proficient in C++, please send a screenshot of a recent project you have completed.
	1. Complete the [Udacity] C++ Nanodegree program. This program covers modern C++ techniques, including memory management and real-time processing, which are crucial for neurotech applications like brain-computer interfaces (BCIs).
	2. Complete the [MIT OpenCourseWare] course. This platform offers foundational C++ programming concepts used in computational neuroscience and neuroimaging, making it a solid starting point for neurotech applications.
